abstract_summ: Patients with respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) detection had a lower onset of empirical antibiotic therapy (35.1% vs 55.9% p-value) Patients with RSV or influenza (receiving 45.2 days vs. 68% of those not identified) Multiplex PCR testing for respiratory viruses with results available within 24 hours did not reduce the consumption of bacterial antibiotics .
